* Creates a Deadline representing the task the user
* wishes to store. If the deadline is entered in a
* recognisable format, then the deadline is stored
* as a date and time rather than simply a String.
* @param name Name of task to be completed.
* Formats the Deadline task for display to the user.
* @return The output string to be displayed.
* Formats the Deadline task as it is to be stored/saved
* @return The string the task is to be saved as.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image image) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image image) {
* Initialises the Duke program on startup
* by loading the previously saved task list
* onto the working list, if there exists one.
* Otherwise, the working list starts empty.
* Creates an Event Task representing the event the user
* wishes to store. If the event date/time is entered in a
* recognisable format, then the event date/time is stored
* as a date and time rather than simply a String.
* @param input Date and time of event.
* Formats the Event task for display to the user.
* @return The output string to be displayed.
* Formats the Event task as it is to be stored/saved
* @return The string the task is to be saved as.
private final String BYE_MESSAGE = "    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n";
* Parses the user input and processes the commands accordingly.
* Returns false to exit the program loop if the command is "bye",
* @param input Input string entered by user.
* @param list Working task list of the program, for updating.
* @return false if user input is "bye", and true otherwise.
public String parseCommand(String input, TaskList list) {
response += "    Here are the tasks in your list:\n";
response += "    Oops! The description of a todo cannot be empty.\n";
response += "    Oops! A deadline must contain both a task "
response += "    Oops! An event must contain both an event "
response += "    Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n      "
response += "    Noted. I've removed this task:\n";
response += "    Now you have " + list.size() + " task"
response += "    Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
response += "    Oops! A 'find' command must be followed by a search word.\n";
response += "    Oops! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :(\n";
* Loads a previously saved task list from the hard disk
* @param list Working task list of the program, for loading the saved data onto.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file specified by the filepath cannot be found.
public void load(TaskList list) throws FileNotFoundException {
* Saves any changes to the task list to the hard disk
* immediately by overwriting the original file.
* @param list Updated working task list of the program, for rewriting the file with.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs in writing the file.
* Outputs a tick or cross symbol to indicate whether
* or not a task has been completed.
* @return A tick if task is done, and a cross otherwise.
* Allows a task to be marked as done.
* Formats the task for display to the user.
* @return The output string to be displayed.
* Formats the task as it is to be stored/saved
* @return The string the task is to be saved as.
* Returns the greeting message display on startup.
return "    Hello! I'm Duke!\n" + "    What can I do for you today?\n";
* Returns the farewell message when user exits the application.
return "    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n";
public String getAddedMessage(Task task, TaskList list) {
output += "    Got it. I've added this task:\n";
output += "    Now you have " + list.size() + " task"
return "    Oops! The task you referred to is not on the list.\n"
+ "    Please refer to the list using the 'list' command.\n";
return "    Oops! This command must be followed by a task number.\n";

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefHeight="200.0" prefWidth="400.0" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/11.0.1" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" />
<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" />
<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0">
